{{cpp/title|tolower{{small|(std::locale)}}}}
{{cpp/locale/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=locale|
template&lt; class CharT &gt;
CharT tolower( CharT ch, const locale&amp; loc );
}}

Converts the character {{c|ch}} to lowercase if possible, using the conversion rules specified by the given locale's {{lc|std::ctype}} facet.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|ch|character}}
{{par|loc|locale}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Returns the lowercase form of {{c|ch}} if one is listed in the locale, otherwise return {{c|ch}} unchanged.

===Notes===
Only 1:1 character mapping can be performed by this function, e.g. the Greek uppercase letter 'Σ' has two lowercase forms, depending on the position in a word: 'σ' and 'ς'. A call to {{lc|std::tolower}} cannot be used to obtain the correct lowercase form in this case.

===Possible implementation===
{{eq fun
|1=
template&lt;class CharT&gt;
CharT tolower(CharT ch, const std::locale&amp; loc)
{
    return std::use_facet&lt;std::ctype&lt;CharT&gt;&gt;(loc).tolower(ch);
}
}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cwctype&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;locale&gt;

int main()
{
    wchar_t c = L'\u0190'; // Latin capital open E ('Ɛ')

    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::hex &lt;&lt; std::showbase;

    std::cout &lt;&lt; "in the default locale, tolower(" &lt;&lt; (std::wint_t)c &lt;&lt; ") = "
              &lt;&lt; (std::wint_t)std::tolower(c, std::locale()) &lt;&lt; '\n';

    std::cout &lt;&lt; "in Unicode locale, tolower(" &lt;&lt; (std::wint_t)c &lt;&lt; ") = "
              &lt;&lt; (std::wint_t)std::tolower(c, std::locale("en_US.utf8")) &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|p=true
|output=
in the default locale, tolower(0x190) = 0x190
in Unicode locale, tolower(0x190) = 0x25b
}}
